nodes.bodyText: This is a public method. We should ideally maintain it's signature.
Consider creating a method that takes a collection of properties and iterates over them calling String.valueOf  (since it's repeated multiple times here) while concatenating them.
Like the previous pr we can use an array to remove the need for the length checks.

Is there a reason we don't have the text set to empty by default? We end up repeating the same logic here https://github.com/OpenSRP/opensrp-client-native-form/pull/524/files#diff-607b2f74eb9df7c9ec407f98d71dc161ce12967b037b971ddcc4564b8ff5fefeR244 right?
you mean on the xml?  if yes the text attribute of the TextView has been assigned a string resource id ; if no we will still need to call .setText() for each of those views

Why do you need to call setText twice if it's being set to empty string? Can't it be done once initially (as a default) and let the values be overwritten if data for them exists?
Also, couldn't the xml have the default value already set?
Why do you need to call setText twice if it's being set to empty string? its not called twice there is an else
Isn't the same logic done in both the if and else?
Yeah its done in if only if the value has fewer coordinate elements than the number of textViews ... its done on else only when the value attribute does not exist
am only setting to empty when needed
Wouldn't it be cleaner to have the defaults already in place and not have to add an else or to worry about checking if the coordinates were fewer?
Maybe but ... just thought calling .setText twice for all the views i.e one for setting empty text and the other for actual text, will be unnecessary.

The ideal way would be to have the default text in xml, is this not possible?
Either way I think the benefit of having concise and non-repeated code is a win here since the setText operation is not expensive.
Aren't we trying to join the coordinateElements with a space?
No need for this else block, we can set dataView.setTag(R.id.raw_value, ""); as the default value to be overwritten only if we have gps values.
